  • When traversing the Upside Down, the portal you enter is destroyed. Gain an additional 200 Bloodpoints for the traversal.
name: Rotten Pumpkin

description:
A chewy rat tail for The Demogorgon to consume.
  • Slightly decreases the time taken to open a Portal.
name: Rat Tail

description:
A soggy pile of salty, soft liver.
  • Slightly increases Killer movement speed while charging Of the Abyss.
name: Rat Liver

description:
A black fermented heart ripped from the chest of a tentacled creature in the Upside Down.
  • Slightly increases Shred hit attack recovery speed.
name: Black Heart

description:
Wet, elastic webs that broaden the interdimensional tunnels.
  • Slightly increases the time taken by survivors to seal a Portal.
name: Viscous Webbing

description:
A fetid, viscous layer that covers and expands the interdimensional tunnels.
  • Moderately increases the radius in which survivors can be detected by Of the Abyss.
name: Sticky Lining

description:
Rotten tripe that fuels The Demogorgon.
  • Slightly increases Killer movement Speed while traversing the Upside Down.
name: Rotten Green Tripe

description:
The tasty guts of an unfortunate victim.
  • Increases the total number of available Portals by 1.
  • Slightly increases Shred missed attack recovery speed.
name: Mew's Guts

description:
A broken pair of glasses that traveled to the Upside Down.
  • Slightly increases Shred recovery speed when breaking a pallet
name: Barb's Glasses

description:
A dark fleshed mushroom from the Upside Down that allows The Demogorgon to telepathically distort the senses in its prey.
  • Slightly increases the duration of the Undetectable status effect applied to The Demogorgon when emerging from a Portal.
name: Violet Waxcap

description:
Thick, thorny vines that stretch and reinforce the interdimensional tunnels.
  • Slightly increases the time taken by survivors to seal a Portal.
  • Slightly increases the radius in which survivors can be detected by Of the Abyss.
name: Thorny Vines

description:
A soda can charged with psychic energy.
  • Shows yellow Auras for Generators being repaired while traversing the Upside Down
name: Eleven's Soda

description:
A raw, rubbery lung that reinvigorates The Demogorgon.
  • Considerably increases Killer movement Speed while traversing the Upside Down.
  • Reduces number of available portals by 2.
name: Deer Lung

description:
A lighter used to ignite trouble.
  • survivors under the effect of a Portal suffer from the Blindness status effect. Once out of contact with the Portal, this effect persists for 60 seconds.
name: Brass Case Lighter
flavor: “Emits a strong electromagnetic field: it must have come into contact with the Upside Down.” - Hawkins National Laboratory

description:
A bright red poisonous mushroom from the Upside Down.
  • Moderately increases the duration of the Undetectable status effect applied to The Demogorgon when emerging from a Portal.
name: Vermillion Webcap
flavor: "Still experimenting with this specimen, so far our results are inconsistent." - Hawkins National Laboratory

description:
A sticky, flammable sap that fortifies the gateway to the interdimensional tunnels.
  • Moderately increases the time taken by survivors to seal a Portal.
name: Upside Down Resin
flavor: “A sample taken from a tree that concealed a Portal to another plane. Studies on its effects are inconclusive.”- Hawkins National Laboratory

description:
A large, warm egg coated in gruesome webbing.
  • Considerably increases the power recovery speed of traversing the Upside Down.
name: Unknown Egg
flavor: “A large egg was sighted in the Upside Down, but no sample survived the trip to the lab for proper examination.” - Hawkins National Laboratory

description:
A rusty, metal whistle that once ruled the Hawkins public pool.
  • survivors near activated Portals are indicated by Killer Instinct without having to charge Of the Abyss.
  • Slightly reduces detection radius.
name: Lifeguard Whistle
flavor: “Emits a strong electromagnetic field: it must have come into contact with the Upside Down.” - Hawkins National Laboratory

description:
A psychedelic moss that grows on tree barks in the Upside Down.
  • When traversing the Upside Down, The Demogorgon emerges from the target portal silently but more slowly.
  • Tremendously increases the duration of the Undetectable status effect applied to The Demogorgon when emerging from a portal.
name: Red Moss
flavor: “Consuming its leaf enhances athletic performance and causes euphoria.” - Hawkins National Laboratory

description:
A potent lichen that grows like dust on the rocks in the Upside Down.
  • Reveals the Auras of all survivors while traversing the Upside Down, and for 3 seconds after emerging from a portal.
name: Leprose Lichen
flavor: “One small dose can cause severe hallucinations.” - Hawkins National Laboratory

description:
Considering his goals pure and just, Kazan carried a trinket to ward off evil that might lead him astray.
  • Slightly increases Blood Orbs absorption speed.
name: Yaku-Yoke Talisman

description:
Had the rope been stronger, it would have likely held Kazan. As it was, he escaped and butchered his captors.
  • Slightly increases the distance that Blood Orb auras can be detected.
name: Rotting Rope
flavor: "Though Death is focused, he has been known to blink." -Renjiro's Doctrine 14:5

description:
A cup from Kazan's wedding ceremony, it never made it through the night before being damaged.
  • Slightly increases activation charge rate to initiate Blood Fury.
  • Slighty decreases deactivation time of Blood Fury.
name: Cracked Sakazuki

description:
Fell off during one of Kazan's hundred winter treks to the temple. Despite his pilgrimage, Akito's leg would never heal.
  • Slightly increases movement speed while absorbing Blood Orbs.
name: Blackened Toenail
flavor: "If a father sacrifices not for his children, then who does he father?" -Renjiro's Doctrine 11:12

description:
A horned crest Kazan tore from his helmet after being compared to a demon.
  • Slightly increases passive recharge rate of Yamaoka's Wrath.
name: Polished Maedate

description:
An ink painting that once hung in the Yamaoka estate. Depicts the story of a lion eaten by mice.
  • Slightly increases activation charge rate to initiate Blood Fury.
  • Slight decreases deactivation time of Blood Fury.
  • Moderately decreases consumption penalty of Blood Fury when downing a Survivor.
name: Ink Lion

description:
A baton that belonged to Renjiro, it was stolen by Kazan upon his departure.
  • Slightly increases the duration of Blood Fury.
name: Chipped Saihai

description:
Akito's practice sword. The child had little use for it after his injury.
  • Moderately increases the distance that Blood Orb auras can be detected.
name: Child's Wooden Sword

description:
Blood from a boy who called Kazan The Imposter Noble. Kazan hid evidence of the fight from his father, often reveling at the sash in secret.
  • Moderately increases movement speed while absorbing Blood Orbs.
name: Bloody Sash

description:
The banner of the Yamaoka family, Kazan felt an overwhelming pride from it.
  • Moderately increases the duration of Blood Fury.
name: Yamaoka Sashimono

description:
A mask that a young Kazan bought to celebrate Setsubun, its repulsively fanged mouth began haunting his nightmares.
  • Slightly increases the amount of Blood Orbs dropped by survivors.
name: Wooden Oni Mask
flavor: "It is no coincidence that man is so familiar with demons." -Renjiro's Doctrine 3:8

description:
The fragments of an ancestral blade, destroyed by Kazan in a fit of rage.
  • Moderately increases passive recharge rate of Yamaoka's Wrath.
name: Shattered Wakizashi

description:
The topknot of a samurai who questioned Kazan's honor. The roots cling to a thin strip of bloody skin.
  • Considerably increases activation charge rate to initiate Demon Dash while Blood Fury is active.
name: Scalped Topknot

description:
A trinket given to Kazan at birth, its powers are meant to protect his family from harm.
  • Moderately Increases movement speed of Demon Dash while Blood Fury is active.
name: Kanai-anzen Talisman

description:
The cloth that Kazan's mother cried into when he left on his pilgrimage to cleanse the samurai.
  • Considerably decreases consumption penalty of Blood Fury when downing a Survivor.
name: Tear Soaked Tenugui

description:
Fragments of a ship that carried Renjiro Yamaoka. Against all odds, the legendary samurai seemed to survive.
  • Moderately increases the amount of Blood Orbs dropped by survivors.
name: Splintered Hull
flavor: "To plan subterfuge, begin with a counsel of none." -Renjiro's Doctrine 7:9

description:
A tooth sold from an exotic vendor, it symbolizes power and nobility.
  • Considerably increases the duration of Blood Fury.
name: Lion Fang

description:
The crutch used by Kazan's son after falling from a tree. Akito's playmate and her family were punished for the boy's injury.
  • Considerably increases movement speed of Demon Dash while Blood Fury is active.
name: Akito's Crutch

description:
The glove Renjiro held to his sternum following the strike dealt by his son.
  • All survivors can see Blood Orbs.
  • A Survivor coming into contact with a Blood Orb will absorb the Blood Orb and reveal their aura to The Killer for 2 seconds.
  • This effect stacks for each Blood Orb absorbed.
name: Renjiro’s Bloody Glove
flavor: "When all else spills out, cling only to your honor." -Renjiro's Doctrine 14:12

description:
A crest that denotes its owner as being a part of the Yamaoka family.
  • While Blood Fury is active, missing a Demon Strike will cause all survivors within a 12-meter radius to scream and reveal their current location to you.
name: Iridescent Family Crest
flavor: "Know who you are so you may shield your heart." -Renjiro's Doctrine 11:2

description:
A grimy piece of burlap. Spit and elbow grease was enough to wipe down the speargun in the heat of a shootout.
  • Slightly decreases the Speargun’s cool-down time after missed shots.
name: Spit Polish Rag

description:
A tincture of oils and extracts purchased from a travelling salesman. Purported to cure all that ails you.
  • Slightly increases the Speargun’s Reeling speed.
name: Snake Oil

description:
Weak steel links first used on Caleb's prototype Speargun. Despite the chain's failings, it holds sentimental value.
  • Grants 50% bonus Bloodpoints for Speared score events.
  • survivors break free more easily.
name: Rickety Chain

description:
An old ammo belt Caleb altered for his specialized weaponry. Still holds the fine red dirt of the Arizona Territory desert.
  • Slightly increases the Speargun’s Reload speed.
name: Modified Ammo Belt

description:
A railroad spike that Caleb fastened to the front of the Speargun during a moment of morbid curiosity. The dull tip prevents it from cleanly piercing its target.
  • Hitting a speared Survivor inflicts the Mangled status effect.
name: Rusted Spike

description:
An ordinary looking plant, Caleb found that spears coated in its oil caused unbearable blistering around wounds.
  • Slightly increases Survivor’s Mending time when affected by the Deep Wound status effect.
name: Poison Oak Leaves

description:
A silver badge taken from the corpse of a lawman in Arizona Territory who interfered with the Hellshire Gang’s bounties.
  • Slighty reduces the Terror Radius while aiming down the Speargun’s sights.
  • Slightly reduces movement speed while aiming down the Speargun’s sights.
    • “Get your prayers in, you’ll be swinging by noon.” -Caleb Quinn
name: Marshal's Badge

description:
The bullet that ripped through Caleb’s jaw during a frenzied shootout. It brings back a burning desire for revenge.
  • Slightly increases movement speed while aiming down the Speargun’s sights.
    • "You called death to your door the instant you done me wrong." -Caleb Quinn
name: Jaw Smasher

description:
A can of clipped and sweetened tobacco leaves lifted from a gutted body in Glenvale. Stimulates the nervous system.
  • Moderately decreases the stun duration when Survivor’s break free from the Speargun.
name: Chewing Tobacco

description:
The dull jangle of the keys evokes a furious memory within Caleb.
  • Moderately increases the Speargun’s Reload speed.
name: Warden’s Keys

description:
The yellowed remains of a wanted poster for Mason Kelly. Kept Caleb focused on the hunt.
  • Moderately increases movement speed while aiming down the Speargun’s sights.
    • "You'll be met with a fierce reckoning, swear it on my mum’s grave." -Caleb Quinn
name: Wanted Poster

description:
A can holding a small amount of oil to reduce friction in machinery. Early models of the Speargun were notorious for jamming, and oil had to be readily available.
  • Moderately decreases the Speargun's cool-down time after missed shots.
name: Tin Oil Can

description:
Angered with a bounty who fled twice before, Caleb twisted thorn branches onto a spear and let it loose.
  • survivors who break free from the Speargun are inflicted with the Mangled status effect.
name: Honey Locust Thorns

description:
A golden tooth torn from Henry Bayshore as he screamed for mercy, hours before he was finished off.
  • Moderately increases the Speargun’s Reeling speed.
    • “Know your place, boy. Know your damn place.” -Henry Bayshore
name: Bayshore’s Gold Tooth

description:
A thick, heavy chain that once held a steel ball and latched to Caleb’s ankle. It’s been repurposed to hook onto a spear.
  • Considerably increases the charges required for a Survivor to break free from a spear.
    • “Inmates working beyond the prison yard must be affixed with a steel ball of no less than 18 pounds.” -Hellshire Penitentiary Guard Book
name: Prison Chain

description:
Warm comfort in a bottle that quelled Caleb’s anger and slowed his step.
  • Moderately reduces the Terror Radius while aiming down the Speargun’s sights.
  • Moderately reduces movement speed while aiming down the Speargun’s sights.
    • “A smooth taste for the rugged frontier” -Gold Creek Advertisement, 1876
name: Gold Creek Whiskey

description:
A quality cigar, plucked from the jacket of Caleb’s boss while he wailed over the spear lodged in his abdomen.
  • Considerably decreases the stun duration when survivors break free from a spear.
    • “Do not point that thing at me, you slack-jawed imbecile.” -Henry Bayshore
name: Bayshore’s Cigar

description:
Pliable American made steel lined with sharp barbs. Despite its simplicity, Caleb found it could be wrapped around a spear to increase its viciousness.
  • Moderately increases Survivor’s Mending time when affected by the Deep Wound status effect.
    • “There won’t be nothing to fear soon. Till then, fear me.” -Caleb Quinn
name: Barbed Wire

description:
A glass-like coin moulded from The Fog itself. Payment to the bounty hunter for services rendered.
  • survivors speared from at least 15 meters away are inflicted with the Exposed status effect for as long as they remain speared.
    • “Deals made in desperation are paid for in madness.”
name: Iridescent Coin

description:
The Hellshire Gang’s branding iron. Despite folklore, it never made its mark on new initiates, instead having been used to brand particularly quarrelsome bounties.
  • For as long as a Survivor remains speared, the auras of all survivors within your Terror Radius are revealed.
    • “Hellshire Gang: Justice Seekers or Outlaws?” -Glenvale Gazette headline
name: Hellshire Iron

description:
Found in a refrigerator. It’s engraved with a disgusting, bloated face.
  • Slightly increases the duration Rites of Judgment trails remain in the environment.
name: Lead Ring

description:
A butterfly found on a bed at Wood Side Apartments. It’s frail and nearly falls apart when touched.
  • Slightly increases the recharge rate of Rites of Judgment.
name: Dead Butterfly

description:
Found in the basement of Brookhaven Hospital. It’s engraved with a picture of a spider.
  • Slightly increases the total amount of time that Rites of Judgment can be performed.
name: Copper Ring
flavor: “I was locked up inside the basement’s basement. It was so small and dark, and I was so afraid. I dropped my precious ring. But I’ll never, ever go back there.”

description:
A nylon strap that was used to restrain a victim to a metal frame. The color makes it difficult to see the blood soaked into it.
  • Slightly increases the reach of Punishment of the Damned.
name: Black Strap

description:
A doll carved from wax, handcrafted by a prisoner who would soon face their judgment.
  • Moderately increases the reach of Punishment of the Damned.
name: Wax Doll

description:
The sharp, rusted tip of a spear. It’s flaked with blood from its last victim.
  • Moderately increases the total amount of time that Rites of Judgment can be performed.
name: Spearhead

description:
A shred of pink, leopard print fabric. It’s difficult to tell what it was used for.
  • Slightly increases the duration of Killer Instinct when triggered by Rites of Judgment.
name: Leopard-Print Fabric
flavor: “It doesn’t matter who I am. I’m here for you, James.” -Maria

description:
A videotape of two lovers vacationing in Silent Hill. Despite its sentimental value, it was left behind in the Lakeview Hotel.
  • Moderately increases the recharge rate of Rites of Judgment.
name: Forgotten Videotape

description:
A music box with a figure from the fairy tale Cinderella. Found inside a suitcase adorned with stickers from multiple destinations.
  • Moderately increases the duration Rites of Judgment trails remain in the environment.
name: Cinderella Music Box

description:
A photograph of two figures in red hoods. Entitled Crimson and White Banquet for the Gods.
  • Considerably increases the recharge rate of Rites of Judgment.
name: Valtiel Sect Photograph

description:
A metal tablet engraved with Aztec figures.
  • Considerably increases the total amount of time that Rites of Judgment can be performed.
name: Tablet of the Oppressor

description:
A painting of an imposing figure wearing a steel pyramid atop his head. Victims are caged in the background.
  • Moderately increases the duration of Killer Instinct when triggered by Rites of Judgment.
name: Misty Day, Remains of Judgment
flavor: "It’s him...”

description:
The smooth grey foot of a mannequin, brutally torn from its leg.
  • Considerably increases the duration Rites of Judgment trails remain in the environment.
name: Mannequin Foot

description:
A diagram of the Lakeview Hotel. Red flames are painted over this place of guilt.
  • Considerably increases the reach of Punishment of the Damned.
name: Burning Man Painting

description:
A fresh egg, strikingly red in color. About the size of a quail’s egg.
  • Considerably increases the duration of Killer Instinct when triggered by Rites of Judgment.
name: Scarlet Egg
flavor: "I’ve never been so scared in my whole life! You couldn’t care less about me... could you?” -Maria

description:
An old-looking egg, colored reddish orange. About the size of a quail’s egg.
  • survivors affected by Rites of Judgment suffer from the Blindness status effect for 60 seconds.
name: Rust-colored Egg
flavor: “James... You made me happy.” -Mary

description:
A book about the history and legends of Silent Hill and the surrounding area.
  • survivors affected by Rites of Judgment suffer from the Oblivious status effect for 15 seconds.
    • “They called this place ‘The Place of the Silent Spirits.’”
name: Lost Memories Book

description:
A book about an ancient god. Author unknown.
  • Injured survivors affected by Torment suffer from the Hemorrhage status effect.
name: Crimson Ceremony Book
flavor: “Speak. I am the Crimson One. The lies and the mist are not they, but I.”

description:
An ancient looking goblet carved from pure obsidian.
  • The Executioner gains the Undetectable status effect when standing on a Rites of Judgment trail.
name: Obsidian Goblet
flavor: “Forgive me for waking you. But without you, I just can’t go on.” -James Sunderland

description:
A talisman with an odd design inscribed on it. The Entity’s influence seems to have altered it.
  • When sending a Survivor to a Cage of Atonement, the auras of all survivors suffering from Torment are revealed for 6 seconds.
name: Iridescent Seal of Metatron
flavor: "This magic square, with strong protective and dispelling properties, is called the 'Virun VII Crest' or the 'Seal of Metatron'.”

description:
A pill that’s utterly ineffective... or is it?

  • Moderately decreases movement speed while Rushing.
  • Gain 100% bonus Bloodpoints on Rush score events.
name: Placebo Tablet

description:
A poisonous plant that sparked Talbot’s interest in chemistry. It rekindles deeply buried memories.

  • Slightly increases recovery speed after a Rush.
name: Foxglove

description:
This early sample failed to achieve desired results but demonstrated surprising effects regardless.

  • Automatically face the nearest Survivor within 16 meters after a Slam.
name: Compound Seven

description:
A monocle Talbot rarely used despite his eyesight weakening in later years.

  • Displays the target location of a Slam.
name: Chipped Monocle

description:
The remnants of Talbot’s notes, they still contain some valuable information within.

  • Decreases the amount of available Rush tokens by 1.
  • Moderately increases token regeneration rate.
name: Shredded Notes

description:
Dried pustula petals ground into a fine dust.

  • Moderately increases Slam duration.
name: Pustula Dust

description:
A sample of The Plague’s bile, distilled and treated with a mixture of chemicals.

  • Slightly increases turn rate while Rushing.
name: Plague Bile

description:
A sizable thorn snipped from a visceral canker. It secretes a mild toxin.

  • Moderately increases recovery speed after a Rush.
name: Canker Thorn

description:
A rat that briefly returned to life when injected with serum, becoming aggressive and uncontrollable.

  • Moderately increases Rush speed for each consecutive Rush.
name: Blighted Rat

description:
Regular sea salt that has momentarily passed through the spirit world, altering its properties in the process.

  • Moderately increases turn rate while Rushing.
name: Umbra Salts

description:
A mixture made with dried roses from the exceedingly rare New Moon Bouquet.

  • Considerably increases Slam duration.
    •
name: Rose Tonic

description:
A serum that's fatal to humans. It evokes beneficial qualities in those who are... something more.

  • When initiating a Slam, reveal the aura of survivors within 8 meters of the collision location for 3 seconds.
name: Compound Twenty-One

description:
A dead crow that has been grotesquely mutated by blight serum.

  • Considerably increases Rush speed for each consecutive Rush.
name: Blighted Crow

description:
A hormone removed from an unwilling subject’s adrenal gland. Though it provides a jolt of energy, it can fatigue its user.

  • Tremendously reduces turn rate while Rushing.
  • Tremendously increases token regeneration rate.
  • Increases the amount of available Rush tokens by 2.
  • Considerably increases maximum look angle while Rushing.
name: Adrenaline Vial
flavor: "Please, don't do this..."

description:
The journal of a man who claimed to have returned from the Void. The knowledge within has practical applications.

  • Gain the Undetectable status effect while Rushing.
name: Vigo's Journal
flavor: "In a wasteland of forgotten dreams and endless routine, the man with a way out is God." —Talbot Grimes

description:
Talbot used this stone to carve what he believed was his research into the opium den’s walls.

  • Hitting a Survivor with a Lethal Rush will call upon The Entity to block pallets within a 12 meter radius of your location for 6 seconds.
name: Summoning Stone
flavor: "Death is only the beginning."

description:
A chemical squeezed from the pineal gland of a recently deceased Survivor.

  • During a Rush, the moment you enter the 16-meter radius around a Survivor who is repairing or healing, trigger a tremendously difficult Skill Check for that Survivor. Can activate once per Survivor per Rush. Does not trigger for a Rush starting within 16 meters of the Survivor.
name: Soul Chemical
flavor: "...suspected to cause atypical alterations in neural rhythmic activity." —Unlabeled mystery school text

description:
A ring given to chemists graduating from the London School of Medicine. It’s a reminder of unrestrained ambition.

  • Hitting a Survivor with a Lethal Rush will instantly recharge all Rush tokens.
name: Alchemist’s Ring
flavor: "The student is accused of grave robbing with the intent of unsanctioned scientific testing." —Faculty reprimand of Talbot Grimes, 1838

description:
A glass-like laboratory tag, moulded from The Fog itself. Either a gift from The Entity or a cruel jest to tag The Blight as he once did to others.

  • Upon using all Rush tokens, your last Lethal Rush will put survivors into the dying state.
name: Iridescent Blight Tag
flavor: "Progress requires drastic change." —Talbot Grimes

description:
Talbot’s penultimate attempt at a serum. Though it did not facilitate his escape, it did have powerful side effects.

  • Any Survivor within 16 meters of a Slam will suffer from the Hindered status effect for 3 seconds.
  • Slamming pallets or breakable walls will destroy them and stun The Blight for 1.5 seconds.
name: Compound Thirty-Three
flavor: "Time is scarce. Let this be the one..." —Talbot Grimes

description:
A miniscule toy sword, only a few inches long. Holding it brought out a violent enthusiasm in Victor.

  • Slightly decreases the time to charge a Pounce.
name: Toy Sword

description:
Charlotte had many ways to mourn Victor’s death. As the fingernails loosened from his rotting hands, she took one in remembrance.

  • Moderately decreases the time for Victor to separate from Charlotte.
name: Tiny Fingernail

description:
A metal bottle filled with milk that has since soured. Loud as Victor could be, he quieted down when presented with his meal.

  • Slightly increases the radius of Victor's shrieks.
name: Soured Milk

description:
A wooden figure that had caught young Victor's eye. He shrieked until his mother stole it from the market, nearly blowing their cover.

  • Displays the target location of a Pounce.
name: Cat Figurine

description:
A glove once owned by The Twins’ mother. During desperate times, it was held over Victor’s mouth to keep him from making a peep.

  • Moderately increases the radius of Victor's shrieks.
name: Madeleine’s Glove

description:
The candelabrum that Victor tipped over, causing his captors to burn. A symbol of his tenacity.

  • Slightly increases the time needed for a Survivor to crush Victor.
name: Ceremonial Candelabrum

description:
An eyeball that belonged to a cat eaten by the starving Deshayes’ family. Victor hid it from his mother, using it as a toy.

  • Victor's shrieks stop when Pounce is fully charged.
name: Cat’s Eye

description:
A hood from one of the men that hunted Charlotte. Soon, he became the prey.

  • Slightly decreases the time it takes for Charlotte to be awoken from her dormant state.
name: Bloody Black Hood

description:
Two teeth that Victor lost long ago. They’re unusually sharp.

  • survivors who remove Victor suffer from the Blindness status effect for 15 seconds.
name: Baby Teeth

description:
A shoddily carved rattle that Victor cried over until his mother stole it for him. It’s entirely too heavy to be trusted to a child.

  • survivors who remove Victor suffer from the Broken status effect for 20 seconds.
name: Weighty Rattle

description:
A hard, unleavened biscuit that Madeleine stole from a town’s market. It wasn’t much, but it was better than most meals.

  • Slightly decreases the cooldown of Pounce.
name: Stale Biscuit

description:
A disgusting, sticky mixture that covered the Deshayes during an escape attempt through the city sewers.

  • Slightly increases the time it takes for a Survivor to remove Victor.
name: Sewer Sludge

description: Rusted Needle
name: Rusted Needle

description:
A cloth Madeleine wore shortly before her death. The Twins kept it as a memento.

  • Slightly increases Victor’s speed.
name: Madeleine’s Scarf
flavor: "...shall hereby be recorded as a service to the greater good and the extermination of evil." — Inquiry into the death of Madeleine Deshayes

description:
A toy soldier Victor clung to when scared. Something about it evoked jealousy in Charlotte.

  • If a Survivor crushes Victor while he’s idle, their aura is revealed for 6 seconds.
name: Victor’s Soldier
flavor: "Kch--kch—k’ull bawd mennn..." — Victor Deshayes

description:
A wooden top shared between The Twins, though Victor wanted it for his own. He learned he could get what he wanted if he clung tightly and screamed.

  • survivors drop any carried item when pounced on by Victor.
name: Spinning Top
flavor: "Hush... hush... it is yours then." — Charlotte Deshayes

description:
A stew of foraged vegetables mixed with moss and bark to create a false sense of fullness.

  • Moderately increases Victor’s speed.
name: Forest Stew
flavor: "Eat... eat, child. You’ll feel better when it’s down." — Madeleine Deshayes

description:
One of the few luxuries Madeleine escaped her past life with. It has a pleasant, disarming scent.

  • survivors within the radius of Victor's shrieking suffer from the Oblivious status effect.
name: Drop of Perfume
flavor: "Beware the deceit of witches, for they exploit the goodness in men’s hearts." — A History of Witches and Demons (1602)

description:
A coarse strip of cloth that a five-year-old Charlotte would put in her mouth. Stopped her from screaming when witch hunters were nearby.

  • Charlotte is granted the Undetectable status effect for 20 seconds after waking from her idle state.
name: Silencing Cloth
flavor: "I don’t like this game anymore, Mother..." — Charlotte Deshayes

description:
A glass-like pendant moulded from The Fog itself. There’s a portrait of Madeleine Deshayes upon it, though something about her depiction seems unsettling.

  • If a Survivor crushes Victor while he’s idle, they suffer from the Exposed status effect for 30 seconds.
name: Iridescent Pendant
flavor: "Your binding is no curse, my loves. It is your strength to draw upon." — Madeleine Deshayes

description:
A pouch with a number of hidden pockets. Used by aspiring magicians and those with something to hide.
  • Increase the maximum carried Blades by 10.
  • Start the trial with 10 extra Blades.
name: Trick Pouch

description:
Blood-rusted knives, worn from overuse. Employed during Ji-Woon's early murders, they hold a place of importance in his heart.
  • Gain 100% bonus Bloodpoints for Showstopper score events.
  • Moderately increases each Survivor’s Laceration Meter.
name: Memento Blades

description:
A set of chords that Ji-Woon never found a song for. Still, the sound is undeniably catchy.
  • Slightly increases movement speed while throwing Blades.
name: Killing Part Chords

description:
Burnt wires from the studio fire that killed four of the five NO SPIN members. Their deaths gave rise to The Trickster.
  • Slightly increases the duration of Main Event.
name: Inferno Wires

description:
A drink invented in a modest Changwon bar. Became a favorite of Ji-Woon's.
  • Moderately increases the duration of Main Event.
name: Tequila Moonrock

description:
An underground single produced by Ji-Woon before achieving fame. Only the biggest NO SPIN fans collected this hidden gem.
  • Slightly increases the time before the Laceration Meter starts decaying.
name: On Target Single

description:
The first throwing knife Ji-Woon ever owned. Purchased by his father, he was expected to put on a show for those frequenting the family restaurant.
  • Slightly increases each Survivor’s Laceration Meter decay duration when out of Blades.
name: Lucky Blade

description:
A signature from the celebrity known as The Trickster. Sore as his wrist was after hundreds of these, it was invigorating to know he was so in demand.
  • Slightly increases the initial throw rate of Blades.
name: Ji-Woon's Autograph

description:
Shoes that Ji-Woon wore during the music video for One Caged Heart. Allows for smooth, graceful movements of the point dance.
  • Moderately increases movement speed while throwing Blades.
name: Caged Heart Shoes

description:
A pocket watch worn by Ji-Woon during a live performance of I’ll Be Waiting for You. It’s a stage prop that doesn’t work and never will.
  • Considerably increases each Survivor's Laceration Meter decay duration when out of Blades.
name: Waiting for You Watch
flavor:
“Don’t run away
Don’t say we’re through
No way to escape this
I’ll be waiting for you”
— NO SPIN’s “I’ll Be Waiting for You”

description:
A wrist brace worn by Ji-Woon during the filming of his music video Ripper. Though unintentional, the design stabilizes the wrist better than many medical braces.
  • Moderately increases the time before the Laceration Meter starts decaying.
name: Ripper Brace

description:
An audio file of victims’ crisp, clear shrieks. Ji-Woon incorporated the sounds into one of his more popular tracks.
  • Moderately decreases each Survivor’s Laceration Meter.
name: Melodious Murder

description:
A limited edition can of soda promoting NO SPIN. High sugar and caffeine content.
  • Moderately increases the initial throw rate.
name: Fizz-Spin Soda

description:
A boa that Ji-Woon draped around a victim’s slashed neck. A number of pockets are concealed within it.
  • Increase the maximum carried Blades by 15.
  • Start the trial with 15 extra Blades.
name: Bloody Boa

description:
Specialty blades that are only seen as faulty by those who lack imagination. A young Ji-Woon dazzled spectators with the tricks he performed.
  • Blades ricochet off the environment twice.
  • Ricochet hits grant bonus Bloodpoints.
name: Trick Blades

description:
The Trickster’s debut album. The coarse and vicious tone was met with a mixed reaction from fans despite critical acclaim.
  • Blades shatter when hitting the environment, dealing 50% Laceration to nearby survivors.
name: Edge of Revival Album
flavor:
“Your whisper on me
Warm as can be
Burning each breath
Till I can’t breathe”
— The Trickster’s “Whispers of Warmth”

description:
Cufflinks gouged into the eyes of a sasaeng fan who made the mistake of stalking Ji-Woon. Rubbing off the blood, there’s so much to be seen in the glitter.
  • When a Survivor’s Laceration Meter is one Blade hit away from the maximum, reveal their aura for 6 seconds.
name: Diamond Cufflinks
flavor: “Shhh... You don’t have to see your blood anymore.” —Ji-Woon Hak

description:
The first single released by NO SPIN after Ji-Woon joined their ranks. Scored an all-kill on the Korean charts.
  • Blades pierce through survivors.
  • Subsequent survivors hit by the same Blade receive 50% Laceration.
name: Cut Thru U Single
flavor:
“Can't stop this love
That's tearing your heart
Wherever you go
I will cut you apart”
— NO SPIN’s “Cut Thru U”

description:
A glass-like photo molded from The Fog itself. Ji-Woon's eyes shimmer holographically on his grinning face.
  • When a Survivor’s Laceration Meter is one Blade hit away from the maximum, they are inflicted with the Exposed status effect.
name: Iridescent Photocard
flavor: “It’s okay, scream my name. Let me hear everything the pain awakens...” —Ji-Woon Hak

description:
A collection of the final sounds from Ji-Woon's victims, adapted to a vinyl record. Terrifying and emotionally raw.
  • Laceration caused by Blades is based on proximity to the target, starting at a minimum of 50%.
  • Each Blade hit increases the Laceration caused by Blades to a maximum of 200%.
  • Once a Blade misses, the Laceration caused by Blades is reset to its initial value.
name: Death Throes Compilation
flavor: “Please, no... don’t make it hurt... I can’t... I...” —Unidentified Voice

description:
An electronic Umbrella wristband for visitors to the facility. It also doubles as a tracking device.
  • Moderately extends zombie detection range.
name: Visitor Wristband

description:
A manual of compiled S.T.A.R.S. close-range combat knowledge. Edited by Chris Redfield.
  • Zombies’ auras turn yellow for 6 seconds after hitting a Survivor.
name: S.T.A.R.S. Field Combat Manual

description:
Medical equipment that fared poorly during the chaos that overwhelmed Raccoon City.
  • Moderately increases time it takes survivors to inject Vaccine.
  • Slightly increases length of Killer Instinct effect time when survivors use Vaccine.
name: Damaged Syringe

description:
The small intestine of Brian Irons, chief of the RPD. It's an appetizing sight for zombies.
  • Slightly increases zombie movement speed.
name: Brian’s Intestine

description:
The heart of an eviscerated zombie. It’s considered hazardous waste as it’s certainly teeming with viruses.
  • Moderately increases mutation rate when destroying zombies with Tentacle Strike.
name: Zombie Heart
flavor: "Words won’t work on this thing." —Leon S. Kennedy

description:
While little was left of Mikhail, his left eyeball survived the blast that killed him. It remains a tasty treat for zombies.
  • Moderately increases zombie movement speed.
name: Mikhail’s Eye

description:
The contaminated blood of a Raccoon City police officer.
  • Moderately increases mutation rate when hitting survivors with Tentacle Strike.
name: Marvin’s Blood
flavor: "All you need to know is that this place will eat you alive if you’re not careful." —Marvin Branagh

description:
A hormone that heightens senses and prepares the body to fight.
  • Considerably increases length of Killer Instinct effect time when survivors use Vaccine.
name: Adrenaline Injector

description:
An electronic Umbrella wristband for administrators of the facility. While allowing access to secure areas, it also doubles as a tracking device.
  • Considerably extends zombie detection range.
name: Admin Wristband

description:
A damaged sample from a T-002 Tyrant that died in combat. There are signs of severe burns.
  • Moderately increases mutation rate when destroying zombies with Tentacle Strike.
  • Moderately decreases zombie respawn time.
name: Tyrant Gore

description:
A sample of the T-Virus developed by Umbrella Corporation, it causes extreme mutations and brain damage in its subjects.
  • Considerably increases mutation rate when destroying zombies with Tentacle Strike.
name: T-Virus Sample

description:
A hormone that slightly relaxes the user for when stealth is required.
  • Gain the Undetectable status effect for 15 seconds when a zombie is destroyed.
name: Serotonin Injector

description:
The tangled remnants of a plant infected with the T-Virus, it killed one of the researchers who developed it.
  • Considerably increases time for survivors to open Supply Cases.
name: Plant 43 Vines

description:
A sticky prehensile tongue that easily wraps around anything it touches.
  • Moderately increases the amount of time survivors are Hindered after being Contaminated.
name: Licker Tongue
flavor: "It’s like... a nightmare." —Claire Redfield

description:
A parasite used in the development of Nemesis T-Types, it’s capable of hijacking its host’s brain.
  • When receiving the Contamination effect, a Survivor suffers from Oblivious status effect for 60 sec.
name: NE-α Parasite

description:
It’s tragically squished and dripping with blood from a recent battle. Despite that, it has a delicious aroma that can’t be missed.
  • Reveals a Survivor's aura for 12 seconds after they unlock a Supply Case.
name: Jill’s Sandwich

description:
Who will save them now? There’s something about this ink ribbon being dry that energizes zombies.
  • Considerably decreases zombie respawn time.
  • Moderately increases zombie movement speed.
  • When 5 generators are repaired, any destroyed zombies respawn in an exit area.
name: Depleted Ink Ribbon
flavor: "Look, just so you know... this is the last fucking time." —Jill Valentine

description:
A coin depicting a bird framed by a laurel wreath. It’s broken in half.
  • Removes 1 Supply Case from the trial.
name: Broken Recovery Coin
flavor: "This is not how I imagined my first day." —Leon S. Kennedy

description:
A symbol of hope for Raccoon City, utterly destroyed.
  • Tremendously increases zombie movement speed for 30 seconds after a generator is repaired.
name: Shattered S.T.A.R.S. Badge
flavor: "S.T.A.R.S..." —Nemesis

description:
A glass-like badge moulded from The Fog itself. It represents a corporation that pushed far beyond ethical and humane science.
  • survivors are inflicted with the Exposed status effect for 12 seconds when using a Vaccine.
